original_title: Sri Lanka sells Rs110bn in T-bill auction, yields fall across maturities
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has sold 110 billion rupees of Treasury bills at an auction on Wednesday, with six months and one year yields falling above 100 basis points, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office sold 50 billion rupees in 3-month bills at 23.00 percent, down 16 basis points from a week earlier, after offering 50 billion rupees.
All of the 30 billion rupees of 6-month bills were sold at 19.49 percent, down 112 basis points from a week earlier.
All offered 30 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 16.99 percent, down 109 basis points from a week earlier. (Colombo/June21/2022)
